    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Note:</font></font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Regulation S-T Rule 101(b)(1) only permits the submission in paper of a
Form 6-K if submitted solely to provide an attached annual report to security
holders.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Indicate by check mark if the registrant is submitting the Form 6-K in
paper as permitted by Regulation S-T Rule 101(b)(7): __</font> </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="PADDING-LEFT: 15pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Note:</font></font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Regulation S-T Rule 101(b)(7) only permits the submission in paper of a
Form 6-K if submitted to furnish a report or other document that the registrant
foreign private issuer must furnish and make public under the laws of the
jurisdiction in which the registrant is incorporated, domiciled or legally
organized (the registrant&#8217;s &#8220;home country&#8221;), or under the rules of the home
country exchange on which the registrant&#8217;s securities are traded, as long as the
report or other document is not a press release, is not required to be and has
not been distributed to the registrant&#8217;s security holders, and, if discussing a
material event, has already been the subject of a Form 6-K submission or other
Commission filing on EDGAR.</font></div>

            <td align="right" nowrap width="27%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">A</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">-</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">1</font></td>

            <td align="left" nowrap width="72%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">FINANCIAL INFORMATION</font></td>

            <td align="left" nowrap width="72%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;MANAGEMENT&#8217;S
      DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</font></td>
            <td align="right" nowrap width="27%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">F-1</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom" bgcolor="silver">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="72%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;CONSOLIDATED
      FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></td>
            <td align="right" nowrap width="27%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">F-2</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom" bgcolor="white">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="72%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Corporate Information</font></td>
            <td align="right" nowrap width="27%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">F-3</font></td>
          </tr></table>
    </div><br>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">This document contains forward-looking
statements, including our estimated revenue and cash flow from operations for
2010, which are provided to enable external stakeholders to understand Ballard's
outlook as at the date of this circular and may not be appropriate for other
purposes. These forward-looking statements are based on the beliefs and
assumptions of Ballard's management and reflect Ballard's current expectations
as contemplated under section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and
Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. Such assumptions
relate to Ballard's financial forecasts and expectations regarding its product
development efforts, manufacturing capacity, and market demand, and include
matters such as generating new sales, producing and delivering the expected
number of units, and controlling its costs.</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">These statements involve risks and
uncertainties that may cause Ballard's actual results to be materially
different, including, without limitation, the rate of mass adoption of its
products, product development delays, changing environmental regulations, its
ability to attract and retain business partners and customers, its access to
funding, increased competition, its ability to protect its intellectual
property, changes in its customers' requirements, foreign exchange impacts on
its net monetary assets and its ability to provide the capital required for
product development, operations and marketing. For a detailed discussion of
these risk factors and other risk factors that could affect Ballard's future
performance, please refer to Ballard's most recent Annual Information Form.
Readers should not place undue reliance on Ballard's forward-looking statements
and Ballard assumes no obligation to update or release any revisions to these
forward-looking statements, other than as required under applicable
legislation.</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">ii</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="right"><img src="ballard_6-k1x7x1.jpg" alt=""> </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Letter from IAN A. BOURNE
</font></font></font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Chair of the
Board</font></font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">&#160;</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Fellow
Shareholders: </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Decisive Actions in a Difficult Economic
Environment </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;The macroeconomic
events of 2009 and the ensuing global recession presented serious challenges to
most companies last year, and that was certainly the case for Ballard given the
early stage of market development for fuel cell products. In a volatile
environment, Boards must be attentive and responsive to changes in business
risks and opportunities. That is just what your Board of Directors did in 2009,
working very closely with our Ballard Management Team. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;We re-assessed the
strategic direction and confirmed that we were focused on the right market
priorities for clean energy, fuel cell products. We agreed with the Management
Team&#8217;s view that the business environment would constrain short-term growth in
revenue and margin. Therefore, given our commitment to drive to near term
profitability, action was required to reduce the cost base. These actions are
always difficult given the impact on employees, but we supported the tough
decisions by Management as the right course to pursue.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;We also believed that
given the increased volatility in the capital markets it was appropriate to take
action to augment the Company&#8217;s cash reserves. Liquidity is even more critical
in uncertain economic times. Your Board of Directors endorsed monetizing the
Ford share purchase agreement and the Burnaby head office sale/leaseback.
Management executed well on both these transactions, thereby providing the
resources we feel will allow us to achieve the next phase of our strategy.
</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;But difficult times
often bring new growth opportunities as well. Management identified an
opportunity to acquire control of Dantherm Power, a fuel cell system integrator
based in Denmark. This transaction closed successfully in January 2010 and as a
result Ballard acquired key systems capability in fuel cell back-up power and
extended our product portfolio and growth capabilities. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Your Board of
Directors was very actively engaged in 2009, working with Management in areas
related to financial reporting due to the new IFRS standards, changes to equity
compensation plans, and ongoing strategy assessments. As well, the Board and the
Audit Committee were fully engaged with Management when approving the
transactions to (1) monetize the Ford share purchase agreement, (2) acquire
control of Dantherm Power, (3) exit the Ebara Ballard joint venture, and (4)
execute the head office sale/leaseback. The Board chose to reduce its cost
structure in recognition of the economic situation and to be more consistent
with the current stage of the Company&#8217;s evolution. We reduced both director
compensation and ancillary expenses.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">1</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Strong Board Governance Focus in 2009
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;The Board is
comprised of directors who combine extensive executive and governance experience
with a strong commitment to Ballard. As such, we are well positioned to provide
strong board governance. We believe strong governance combines approval of
strategy and resource allocation with oversight of management and business
risks.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Effective execution
by a board requires clear policies that are regularly updated, focused work by
the appropriate committee (their mandates are outlined in the following report)
and the leadership and active engagement of skilled and experienced directors.
Business performance improves as a result of strong governance.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Our Passionate Ballard Employees
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;As I noted in my
Letter to Shareholders last year, I continue to be impressed by the passion,
dedication, and enthusiasm shown by the employees of Ballard. While the economic
backdrop in 2009 and related cost-cutting initiatives posed difficult impacts,
our employees continued to demonstrate their resilience and commitment. So I am
especially proud this year to recognize the employees who went &#8216;Above and
Beyond&#8217; with their 2009 achievements. This year&#8217;s winners can be found in the
following table. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Also, along with my
fellow Directors, I congratulate the Ballard Management Team for their strong
leadership in a very difficult and volatile economic environment. While our
progress in product shipments and revenue growth fell short of the original
goals for 2009, we drove significant progress on our broader market positioning,
our path to profitability and in strengthening our balance sheet. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;In closing I would
like to acknowledge Gerri Sinclair who has decided to retire from the Board due
to other business commitments. I want to recognize her contribution to Ballard
as a director for the past 5 years and wish her well. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Finally, I would like
to thank you, our shareholders, for your continued support of Ballard as we
continue to drive progress in building a leading fuel cell products company and
a profitable clean energy growth company. I look forward to reporting next year
on our 2010 progress. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Ian A. Bourne</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">" </font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">&#160;</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps">Ian
A. Bourne</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Chair of the Board of Directors
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">2</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="right"><img src="ballard_6-k1x9x1.jpg" alt=""> </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Letter from JOHN W. SHERIDAN
</font></font></font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">President and Chief Executive
Officer</font></font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">2009&#8212;A Very Challenging Year for Energy
Technology Companies </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;2009 was a very
difficult year for the economy, with crises in credit and equity markets,
upheaval in the automotive and energy sectors and a pervasive global recession.
Needless to say, this presented challenges to most sectors, but particularly to
energy technology companies in the early stages of market
development.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Market development
for new, clean power solutions requires ongoing investments by system
integrators, channel partners and end-customers &#8211; to replace cheap, incumbent
power solutions that have been in-place for decades, including internal
combustion engines, diesel generators and lead acid batteries. And, while
Ballard did see progress in 2009, there is no doubt that difficult circumstances
in the economy constrained our progress, since our partners and customers were
themselves impacted by depressed demand in end-markets, credit and financing
constraints and liquidity concerns. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Maintaining Strategic Focus while
Adjusting Priorities </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;However, we continued
to see evidence that Ballard is focused on the right markets -</font></div>
    <ul type="square" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Backup and supplemental
  power;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Distributed generation;
  and<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Motive power.</font> </li>
    </ul>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;We see growing demand
for new, clean power solutions to provide extended backup power in
telecommunications networks around the world. We are moving forward with First
Energy in the megawatt distributed power generation space. In material handling,
our partner Plug Power continues to forge progress with leading customers.
Interest in fuel cell public transit programs is heightening. So as the various
economic crises unfolded last year, we did not shift our strategic direction or
our market priorities. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;However, the pace of
market development and revenue growth was clearly impacted by the economic
conditions in 2009. With this reality, and given our commitment to profitability
in the near-term, we heightened our focus on the cost base and balance sheet.
</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">3</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;On the cost front, we
took aggressive, comprehensive actions, including simplification of our
organization structure, cutting discretionary costs, downsizing our employee
base and securing increased government funding to offset our research costs. The
net result was a reduction of 30% in our annual operating expenses, on an annual
&#8216;run rate&#8217; basis. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;On the balance sheet
front, we took action to augment cash reserves, ensuring that our Company would
not be confronted by any real or perceived financing issues as we move forward
to execute our growth plan. On December 21</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">st</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">, we closed the transaction monetizing
our equity position in Automotive Fuel Cell Cooperation Corp. This transaction
secured gross proceeds of $44.5 million, with $37 million received upfront and
an additional contingent payment of $7.5 million due in 2013. As well, we
executed a sale-leaseback transaction for our Burnaby head office building,
which closed in March 2010, with gross proceeds of $20.4 million. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Operating Results for
2009</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Our revenues for 2009
were $46.7 million, down 22% over 2008. Operating cash consumption was $27.5
million for the year, which reflects an improvement of 6% over 2008. Cash
reserves increased significantly, to approximately $82 million, which were
further augmented by the cash proceeds from the head office sale-leaseback
transaction in March. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;While 2009 was a
difficult year for growth, we ended the year with some important momentum.
Progress in market penetration was evidenced by a number of key developments -
</font></div>
    <ul type="square" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Supply agreement with
  </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Daimler </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">for FCvelocity&#8482; fuel cell stacks for
  use in cars and buses, with</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">an estimated minimum value of $24 million over
  2010-11;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Motorola </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">deployed Dantherm Power&#8217;s backup power
  system, incorporating our FCgen&#8482;-</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">1020ACS fuel cell stacks;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Continued development of a
  supplemental power system for the wireless telecom market in India,</font>
  <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">with </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">IdaTech LLC </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Supply agreement with
  </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">First Energy Corporation
  </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">for a 1-megawatt
  distributed generation</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">system for utility load management in Ohio;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Order from </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Advanced Public Transportation Systems
  bv </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">(APTS) for five
  FCvelocity&#8482;-HD6</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">modules
  for buses in the Netherlands;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Plug Power </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">announced commercial orders for its
  GenDrive material handling system from such</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">customers as Central Grocers, Wegmans,
  Whole Foods and Coca-Cola; and<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Award from </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Sustainable Development Technology
  Canada </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">(SDTC) for
  up to C$4.8 million for</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">fuel cell buses in British Columbia.</font> </li>
    </ul>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Also, in January of
this year, we announced a controlling equity position in Dantherm Power, a
Danish fuel cell system integration company. The Dantherm Power acquisition is
important strategically, as it increases Ballard&#8217;s business scope, so that in
addition to providing fuel cell </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">stacks</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> to
leading fuel cell companies like Plug Power, IdaTech and Baxi and </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">power modules</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">
to customers like ISE and APTS, now through Dantherm Power we can provide
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">complete backup power
systems</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">4</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;It&#8217;s also worth
noting that our share price performance was positive in the year. Our stock
price ended 2009 about 67% higher on NASDAQ and 49% higher on the TSX compared
to December 31</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">st</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">, 2008, and out-performed most fuel cell
company comparators.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;To summarize 2009,
while it was a very difficult year we feel positive that we exited &#8217;09 with
important progress on </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">three fronts</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> -</font></div>
    <ul type="square" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Re-setting our cost
  base&#8230;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Strengthening our liquidity
  position&#8230;and<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Building key momentum for
  growth.</font> </li>
    </ul>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Looking Forward &#8211; Our Business Outlook
for 2010 and Beyond </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Continuing weaknesses
and uncertainties in the economy notwithstanding, we feel that we have
positioned our Company for strong growth in 2010. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;We expect revenue
growth this year in excess of 35%, with fuel cell product growth expected to be
driven by:</font></div>
    <ul type="square" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Supplemental power
  applications, using IdaTech reformate-based systems;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Backup power, using Dantherm
  Power direct hydrogen systems in Europe;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Distributed generation, with
  the First Energy project &#8211; we are also anticipating our first
  distributed</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">generation
  order using &#8216;by-product&#8217; hydrogen fuel;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Material handling stack
  shipments to Plug Power, with Plug forging clear progress with their</font>
  <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">customers&#8230;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">and<br></font></font></font>&#160;&#160;
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Fuel Cell buses, with the
  Whistler Transit fleet of 20 fuel cell buses increasing interest among</font>
  <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">other sales prospects.</font>
  </li>
    </ul>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Beyond this strong
outlook for revenue growth, with the changes that we made in our cost structure
last year, we expect that cash flow from operations will improve by 30% in 2010.
And, with our revenue and cost trajectory in 2010, we expect Ballard to be
positioned for positive EBITDA performance during 2011. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Beyond this
&#8216;high-level&#8217; guidance on our path to profitability, we have provided six
specific growth milestones for 2010, that will be used to &#8216;gauge&#8217; our progress
- -</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">1.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Begin shipments of stacks for IdaTech&#8217;s reformate-based
      supplemental power systems in the Indian telecoms market;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" valign="top">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">2.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Deploy Dantherm Power hydrogen-based backup power systems in one
      major, new telecom network;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" valign="top">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">3.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Commission the 1-megawatt &#8216;distributed generation&#8217; system for First
      Energy in Ohio;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" valign="top">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">4.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Book our first &#8216;distributed generation&#8217; system sale, utilizing
      by-product hydrogen;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" valign="top">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">5.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">More than double volume of stack shipments in material handling,
      &#8216;in line&#8217; with Plug Power&#8217;s 2010 shipment target of 1,100 &#8216;GenDrive&#8217;
      systems&#8230;.</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">and</font></font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" valign="top">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">6.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Book new fuel cell bus contracts, to support the deployment of more
      than 25 buses.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">5</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;These specific
milestones underpin our outlook for strong revenue growth in excess of 35% for
2010.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Building a Clean Energy Growth Company
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;As we continue to
build a leading clean energy growth company, we are conscious of the need to
maintain Ballard&#8217;s market leadership in creating compelling fuel cell products.
As a result, we continue to work diligently on enhancing our product
capabilities and partnering with strong players in the clean energy industry.
But, we are also aware that our corporate brand is made up of more than just the
best products, it is supported by our delivery of the best &#8216;solutions&#8217;. The
Ballard brand reflects our ability to harness the passion of our employees to
deliver a superior overall experience to customers in all our markets &#8211;
solutions they will be delighted with. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;In conclusion, I
would like to recognize you, our shareholders, for your support of Ballard and
to thank you for your continuing belief in our company and its
future.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">John Sheridan</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">" </font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">&#160;</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">J</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps">ohn </font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">S</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps">heridan</font></div>
    <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">President &amp; CEO </font></font></div>
    <div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Ballard Power Systems

of proxy and in the Management Proxy Circular accompanying this Notice, so that
it is received by Computershare Investor Services Inc. no later than 1:00 p.m.
(Pacific Daylight Time) on Friday, May 28, 2010. </font></div>

the Meeting. </font></div>

    <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">MANAGEMENT PROXY
CIRCULAR<br></font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">dated as
of April 13, 2010</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">DEFINED TERMS </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">In this Management Proxy Circular:
</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"Ballard",
"Corporation", "we", "us" and "our" refer to Ballard Power Systems Inc.
</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"Beneficial
Shareholders" means holders of our Shares that do not hold our Shares in their
own name, but instead, whose Shares are held on the Record Date by a bank, trust
company, securities broker or other nominee. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"Board" means
the board of directors of Ballard.</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">&#160;</font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"C$" refers to
Canadian currency. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"DSU" means
deferred share unit. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"$" or "dollars"
refer to United States currency unless specifically stated otherwise.
</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"Meeting" means
the 2010 annual meeting of our Registered Shareholders and includes any
adjournment thereof, unless otherwise indicated. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"NASDAQ" means
the NASDAQ Stock Market LLC. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"Record Date"
means 5:00 p.m. Pacific Daylight Time on April 13, 2010. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"Registered
Shareholders" means registered holders of our Shares on the Record
Date.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"RSU" means
restricted share unit. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"Shares" means
common shares without par value in the capital of Ballard.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"TSX" means the
Toronto Stock Exchange. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"US$" refers to
United States currency. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">MATTERS TO BE VOTED
UPON</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Registered
Shareholders or their duly appointed proxyholders will be voting on:
</font></div>
    <ul type="square" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">the election of directors to
  our Board; and<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">the re-appointment of our
  auditors and authorization for our Audit Committee to fix the</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">remuneration of the auditors.</font>
  </li>
    </ul>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">As of the date of this Management Proxy
Circular, we know of no amendment, variation or other matter that may come
before the Meeting other than the matters referred to in the Notice of Annual
Meeting. If any other matter is properly brought before the Meeting, it is the
intention of the persons named in the enclosed proxy to vote the proxy on that
matter in accordance with their best judgment.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">With respect to resolutions to be voted
on at the Meeting, a simple majority of the votes (greater than 50%) cast in
favour by Registered Shareholders, by proxy or in person, will constitute
approval. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">10</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">With Dr. Sinclair&#8217;s decision to retire
from the Board, consistent with our efforts to reduce the Board cost structure,
we have reduced the size of the Board by one director. Accordingly, at the
Meeting you will be asked to elect eight directors. All of our eight nominees
are currently members of the Board. Each elected director will hold office until
the end of our next annual shareholders&#8217; meeting (or if no director is then
elected, until a successor is elected) unless the director resigns or is
otherwise removed from office earlier. If any nominee for election as a director
advises us that he or she is unable to serve as a director, the persons named in
the enclosed proxy will vote to elect a substitute director at their
discretion.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">The following information pertains to our
nominees for election as directors at the Meeting, as of April 13, 2010. The
number of Shares shown as being held by each nominee constitute the number
beneficially owned, or controlled or directed, directly or indirectly, by that
nominee and such information has been provided to us by that nominee.
</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="PADDING-RIGHT: 5pt; PADDING-LEFT: 5pt; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 10pt; PADDING-TOP: 5pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; ">

      Bourne<br></font></font><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Age:
      62</font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
              <div align="left"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Alberta,
      Canada</font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
              <div align="left"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Director
      since: 2003</font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Independent</font></font></font></div>

            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">(2)</font></font></td>
            <td nowrap>
            </td>
            <td nowrap>
            </td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">As of April
      14, 2009 and April 13, 2010,
respectively.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">13</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>

    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">APPOINTMENT OF AUDITORS
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Our Audit Committee has recommended that
KPMG LLP, Chartered Accountants, of 777 Dunsmuir Street, Vancouver, British
Columbia, be nominated at the Meeting for re-appointment as our external
auditors. Our Audit Committee will fix the remuneration of our external auditors
if authorized to do so by shareholders at the Meeting. It is expected that
representatives of KPMG LLP will be present at the Meeting. KPMG LLP was
appointed as our external auditors in 1999. Total fees paid to KPMG in 2009 and
2008 are set forth in the table below. We comply with the requirement regarding
the rotation of our audit engagement partner every five years. The current audit
engagement partner at KPMG LLP may continue in his role until the end of 2010.
</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The following table shows the fees
we incurred with KPMG LLP in 2009 and 2008: </font></div>

    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">For a more detailed description of the
Audit Committee or to see the Audit Committee&#8217;s mandate, a copy of which is
posted on our website, see the section entitled "Board Committees &#8211; Audit
Committee" in our Annual Information Form dated March 15, 2010, which section is
incorporated by reference into this Management Proxy Circular. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">VOTING</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">SOLICITATION OF PROXIES
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">This Management Proxy Circular is
furnished in connection with the solicitation of proxies by our management in
connection with the Meeting to be held on Tuesday, June 1, 2010 at 1:00 p.m.
Pacific Daylight Time in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, or the date and
place of any adjournment thereof. We are soliciting proxies primarily by mail,
but our directors, officers and employees may solicit proxies personally, by
telephone, by facsimile transmission or by other means of electronic
communication. The cost of the solicitation will be borne by us. The approximate
date on which this Management Proxy Circular and the related materials are first
being sent to Registered Shareholders is May 7, 2010. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">HOW TO VOTE </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Only Registered Shareholders or their
duly appointed proxyholders are permitted to vote at the Meeting. Beneficial
Shareholders are not permitted to vote at the Meeting as only proxies from
Registered Shareholders can be recognized and voted at the Meeting. You may vote
as follows: </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Registered
Shareholders</font></font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">:
If you are a Registered Shareholder you may vote by attending the Meeting in
person, or if you do not plan to attend the Meeting, by completing the proxy and
delivering it according to the instructions contained in the form of proxy and
this Management Proxy Circular. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">14</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Beneficial
Shareholders</font></font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">:
If you are a Beneficial Shareholder you may only vote by carefully following the
instructions on the voting instruction form or proxy form provided to you by
your stockbroker or financial intermediary. If you do not follow the special
procedures described by your stockbroker or financial intermediary, you will not
be entitled to vote. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">EXECUTION AND REVOCATION OF PROXIES
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">A Registered Shareholder or the
Registered Shareholder&#8217;s attorney authorized in writing or, where the Registered
Shareholder is a company, a duly authorized officer or attorney of that company,
must execute the proxy. In order to be effective, completed proxies must be
deposited at the office of the registrar and transfer agent for the Shares,
being Computershare Investor Services Inc. ("</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Computershare</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">"), Proxy Dept., 100 University Avenue, 9th Floor, Toronto Ontario, M5J
2Y1 (Fax: within North America: 1-866-249-7775; outside North America:
1-416-263-9524), not less than 48 hours (excluding Saturdays and holidays)
before the time of the Meeting. The individuals named as proxyholders in the
accompanying form of proxy are directors and officers of Ballard. </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">A Registered Shareholder desiring to appoint a person or company (who
need not be a shareholder) to represent him or her at the Meeting, other than
the persons or companies named in the enclosed proxy, may do so by inserting the
name of such other person or company in the blank space provided in the
proxy.</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">A proxy may be revoked by written notice
executed by the Registered Shareholder or by his or her attorney authorized in
writing or, where the Registered Shareholder is a company, by a duly authorized
officer or attorney of that company, and delivered to: </font></div>
    <ul type="square" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Computershare, at the address
  or fax number set out above, at any time up to and including the last business
  day preceding the day of the Meeting at which the proxy is to be
  used;<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">the registered office of the
  Corporation at any time up to and including the last business day preceding
  the day of the Meeting at which the proxy is to be used; or<br>&#160;</font>
        </li>
      <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">the chair of the Meeting on
  the day of the Meeting and before any vote in respect of which the proxy is to
  be used is taken.</font> </li>
    </ul>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">A proxy may also be revoked in any other
manner provided by law. Any revocation of a proxy will not affect a matter on
which a vote is taken before such revocation. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">VOTING OF SHARES AND EXERCISE OF
DISCRETION BY PROXIES </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">If you complete and deposit your proxy
properly, then the proxyholder named in the accompanying form of proxy will vote
or withhold from voting the Shares represented by the proxy in accordance with
your instructions. </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">If you do not specify a choice on any
given matter to be voted upon, your Shares will be voted in favour of such
matter. The proxy grants the proxyholder the discretion to vote on amendments to
or variations of matters identified in the Notice of Annual Meeting and with
respect to other matters that may properly come before the
Meeting</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">VOTING SHARES AND PRINCIPAL SHAREHOLDERS
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">As of the Record Date of April 13, 2010
we had 84,127,616 Shares issued and outstanding, each carrying the right to one
vote. On a show of hands, every individual who is present as a Registered
Shareholder or as a representative of one or more corporate Registered
Shareholders, or who is holding a proxy on behalf of a Registered Shareholder
who is not present at the Meeting, will have one vote, and on a poll, every
Registered Shareholder present in person or represented by proxy and every
person who is a representative of one or more corporate Registered Shareholders,
will have one vote for each Share recorded in the Registered Shareholder&#8217;s name
on the register of shareholders, which is available for inspection during normal
business hours at Computershare and will be available at the Meeting.
</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">As of the Record Date, to the knowledge
of our directors and executive officers, no person beneficially owns, controls
or directs, directly or indirectly, Shares carrying more than 10% of the voting
rights attached to all issued and outstanding Shares carrying the right to vote
in all circumstances. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">15</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">INTEREST OF CERTAIN PERSONS OR COMPANIES
IN MATTERS TO BE ACTED UPON </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">No one who has been a director or
executive officer of ours at any time since January 1, 2009, or any of his or
her associates or affiliates, has any material interest, direct or indirect, by
way of beneficial ownership of Shares or otherwise, in any matter to be acted on
at the Meeting other than the election of directors. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">BOARD AND COMMITTEES</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">BOARD COMPOSITION AND NOMINATION PROCESS
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Our Management Development, Nominating
&amp; Compensation Committee ("</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">MDNCC</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">")
conducts an annual process under which an assessment is made of the skills,
expertise and competencies of the directors and is compared to our needs and the
needs of the Board. This process culminates in a recommendation to the Board of
individual nominee directors for election at our annual shareholders&#8217; meeting.
</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Directors are elected yearly at our
annual shareholders&#8217; meeting and serve on the Board until the following annual
shareholders&#8217; meeting, at which time they either stand for re-election or resign
from the Board. If no meeting is held, each director serves until his or her
successor is elected or appointed, unless the director resigns earlier. The
Board has established director resignation guidelines, which set out the
circumstances under which a director would be compelled to submit a resignation
or be asked to resign. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">MAJORITY VOTING POLICY
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">The Board has adopted a policy which
requires that any nominee for director who receives a greater number of votes
"withheld" than "for" his or her election shall tender his or her resignation to
the Board following our annual shareholders&#8217; meeting, to take effect immediately
upon acceptance by the Board. Upon receipt of such conditional resignation, the
Corporate Governance Committee will consider the matter and, as soon as
possible, make a recommendation to the full Board regarding whether or not such
resignation should be accepted. After considering the recommendation of the
Corporate Governance Committee, the Board will decide whether or not to accept
the tendered resignation and will, not later than 90 days after the annual
shareholders&#8217; meeting, issue a press release which either confirms that they
have accepted the resignation or provides an explanation for why they have
refused to accept the resignation. The director tendering his or her resignation
will not participate in any meeting of the Board or the Corporate Governance
Committee at which the resignation is considered. Subject to any restrictions or
requirements contained in applicable corporate law or Ballard&#8217;s constating
documents, the Board may: (a) leave a resulting vacancy unfilled until the next
annual shareholders&#8217; meeting; (b) appoint a replacement director whom the Board
considers merits the confidence of the shareholders; or (c) call a special
meeting of shareholders to elect a replacement director who may be a person
nominated by management. The policy does not apply in respect of any contested
shareholders&#8217; meeting, which is any meeting of shareholders where the number of
nominees for director is greater than the number of directors to be
elected.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">BOARD MEETINGS </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">The Board meets on a regularly scheduled
basis and directors are kept informed of our operations at meetings of the Board
and its committees, and through reports by and discussions with management. In
2009, </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">in-camera</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> sessions were held after each regularly
scheduled Board meeting. The </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">in-camera</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> sessions consisted of all of the
independent directors without the presence of management. The Chair of the Board
chairs the </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">in-camera</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif"> session. In 2009, there were 5 regularly
scheduled meetings of the Board and 2 extraordinary meetings scheduled on short
notice in connection with changes to director remuneration and committee
membership; and the acquisition by the Corporation of a controlling interest in
Dantherm Power A/S. In addition, communications between the directors and
management occur apart from regularly scheduled Board and committee meetings.
The Board has set a minimum meeting attendance guideline of 70%. Non-compliance
with this guideline by a director is one of the factors considered in his or her
individual performance evaluation at the end of the year. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">16</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">COMMITTEES OF THE BOARD
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">The Board has established three standing
committees: (1) the Audit Committee; (2) the MDNCC; and (3) the Corporate
Governance Committee. Each committee has been delegated certain
responsibilities, performs certain advisory functions and either makes certain
decisions or makes recommendations to the Board. Each committee chair reports on
the activities of the committee to the Board following each committee meeting.
None of the members of these committees are current or former officers or
employees of ours, or any of our subsidiaries. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">In July 2009, in support of the
Corporation's cost reduction initiatives, the Board decided to reduce the size
of the standing committees. This was accomplished by providing that committee
chairs no longer maintain membership on multiple committees. In order to
maintain an adequate quorum on the Corporate Governance Committee following the
departure of Mr. Kilroy from that Committee, Dr. Park joined the Committee at
that time. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">The information below sets out the
members of each of our standing committees and indicates the number of meetings
that each committee held in 2009. After the Meeting, we will reconstitute all of
the committees to reflect the newly elected Board. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Audit Committee </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">The Audit Committee met 8 times during
the financial year ended December 31, 2009. The members in 2009 were Ian A.
Bourne, Edwin J. Kilroy (Chair), David B. Sutcliffe (ceased as of July 13,
2009), Mark A. Suwyn and Douglas W.G. Whitehead. All of the members of the Audit
Committee are independent of our management in accordance with the applicable
Canadian and United States securities laws and exchange requirements.
</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">For a more detailed description of the
Audit Committee or to see the Audit Committee&#8217;s mandate, a copy of which is
posted on our website, see the section entitled "Board Committees &#8211; Audit
Committee" in our Annual Information Form dated March 15, 2010, which section is
incorporated by reference into this Management Proxy Circular. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Management Development, Nominating &amp;
Compensation Committee </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">The MDNCC met 6 times during the
financial year ended December 31, 2009. The members in 2009 were Ian A. Bourne,
Dr. C.S. Park, Dr. Geraldine B. Sinclair, David J. Smith (ceased as of July 13,
2009) and David B. Sutcliffe (Chair). All of the members of the MDNCC are
independent of our management in accordance with the applicable Canadian and
United States securities laws and exchange requirements.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">For a more detailed description of the
MDNCC or to see the MDNCC&#8217;s mandate, a copy of which is posted on our website,
see the section entitled "Board Committees &#8211; Management Development, Nominating
</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">&amp; Compensation
Committee" in our Annual Information Form dated March 15, 2010, which section is
incorporated by reference into this Management Proxy Circular. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Corporate Governance Committee
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">The Corporate Governance Committee met 5
times during the financial year ended December 31, 2009. The members in 2009
were Ian A. Bourne, Dr. C.S. Park (joined as of July 13, 2009), Edwin J. Kilroy
(ceased as of July 13, 2009), Dr. Geraldine B. Sinclair and David J. Smith
(Chair). All of the members of the Corporate Governance Committee are
independent of our management in accordance with the applicable Canadian and
United States securities laws and exchange requirements.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">For a more detailed description of the
Corporate Governance Committee or to see the Corporate Governance Committee&#8217;s
mandate, a copy of which is posted on our website, see the section entitled
"Board Committees &#8211; Corporate Governance Committee" in our Annual Information
Form dated March 15, 2010, which section is incorporated by reference into this
Management Proxy Circular. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">17</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">CORPORATE GOVERNANCE </font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Our Board and senior management consider
good corporate governance to be central to our effective and efficient
operation. We monitor corporate governance initiatives as they develop and
benchmark industry practices to ensure that we are in compliance with corporate
governance rules. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Our corporate governance practices are
reflected in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, which provide for director
qualification standards, director responsibilities, the form and amount of
director compensation, director orientation and continuing education, management
succession planning and performance evaluation of the Board. A copy of the
Corporate Governance Guidelines can be found on our website. We have also
reviewed our internal control and disclosure procedures, and are satisfied that
they are sufficient to enable our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial
Officer to certify our interim and annual reports filed with Canadian securities
regulatory authorities, and to certify our annual reports filed with or
submitted to the SEC. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">In addition, we have set up a process for
shareholders to communicate to the Board, the details of which can be found on
our website. A summary of shareholder feedback is provided to the Board through
a semi-annual report. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">For a more detailed description of our
corporate governance policies and practices, see the section entitled "Corporate
Governance" in our Annual Information Form dated March 15, 2010, which section
is incorporated by reference into this Management Proxy Circular. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">EQUITY BASED COMPENSATION
PLANS</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">In 2009, the Corporation adopted two
equity-based compensation plans approved by our shareholders at the 2009 Annual
Meeting to supersede and replace the prior nine equity compensation plans as
follows: </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
    </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">(a)</font></td>
            <td nowrap>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">a
      consolidated share option plan (the "</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Option Plan</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">") to supersede and replace four
      prior option plans; and</font></td>

      prior SDPs.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Set out in Appendix "A" is a discussion
of the principal terms of the Option Plan. Set out in Appendix "B" is a
discussion of the principal terms of the SDP. </font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">The Corporation also adopted a plan,
administered by an independent trustee, for the purchase of Ballard Shares on
the open market for the redemption of RSU awards (the &#8220;Market Purchase RSU
Plan&#8221;). The independent trustee makes these open market purchases through the
facilities of the TSX, and holds the purchased Shares in escrow until the
restriction period is complete and any performance criteria have been satisfied.
This plan is consistent with the overall move away from the historical practice
of using treasury shares for this purpose.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">COMPENSATION</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">This section of this Management Proxy
Circular contains a discussion of the elements of compensation earned by our
"</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">Named Executive
Officers</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">", who are
listed in the Summary Compensation Table below: John W. Sheridan (President and
Chief Executive Officer), Dave S. Smith<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">(1)</font></font>
</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">(former Vice President and
Chief Financial Officer), Bruce Cousins<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">(2)</font></font>
</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">(Vice President and Chief
Financial Officer), Noordin Nanji (former Vice President, Corporate Strategy and
Development), Christopher J. Guzy (Vice President and Chief Technical Officer)
and Michael Goldstein<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">(3)</font></font>
</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: sans-serif">(Vice President and Chief
Commercial Officer).<br><font size="3">____________________</font></font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 10pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
